Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2009 04:28PM KAR wrote: I had spot compression mammogram and then my core biopsy in a special breast care ctr.  I had lumpectomy/partial mastectomy in day surg at a hospital, under general anesthesia, some do more of a twilight sedation(I think).  It is a simple procedure but I think Id rather have it done in hosp just in case something goes wrong.  Find a surgeon who does breast procedures.  Just my 2 cents Good luck
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy and Lots of Questions please help! Runninhard BarbRocks

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2009 03:00PM KAR wrote: Hi jkeel, Sorry you have to go through this.  Don't worry until you get the results (easier said than done). Unfortunately they just don't know until they do the biopsy and a pathologist reviews the tissue.  I personally had a steriotactic core biopsy that confirmed mine but I didn't have a lump that you could feel either.  I have heard of some ladies on this board who have had excisional biopsy/lumpectomy so I don't think its abnormal.   I bet since your Mother had it at such a young age they are taking it seriously, which in my opinion they should (I'm no Doctor though)  Wishing your lump is a B9 fibroadenoma.  Lot of luck
Posts.Title: is this standard jkeel KAR

Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 08:35AM KAR wrote: Hi sorry you are here but this is a great site with wonderful people who share their experiences.  I was in a similar situation 4 weeks ago.   I think I found some sights explaining what they can find on biopsy and just became familiar with them, when I got the call from the Dr and he said come in I knew it wasn't good.  But when I finally was told I was prepared and had good questions.   Every case is different but in my case knowledge was power and I was glad I prepared myself.  Hoping you get B9 results, don't stress (I know its inevitable)    Please let me know if you have questions or just need to vent, I do understand Karen
Posts.Title: Waiting for Biopsy Results... o2bhealthy lynnea

Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 12:41PM KAR wrote: Mamamari,  So sorry that your are here but this is a great site for info and venting.  I used to live overseas and americans (including me) take our health system for granted.  Sorry its such a sturggle where you are, but you can do this.  Most  ladies on this site understand the stress and panic because weve been there.  Sending you hugs and hope that its b9 even if treatment is neccesarry.  My husband is also gone during the week and it has definitely complicated things with tests and surgery but we're getting through, slowly and so can you.  If you need to talk we'll listen.  Keep us posted. Karen
Posts.Title: Biopsy in Spain...waiting and worrying Mamamari Mamamari

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2010 12:57PM KAR wrote: Hi there, I have no idea what they meant by debris, but just the fact that they didn't say "malignant"  sounds good to me.  I really dont  think surgeons can tell by looking and feeling a lump, any lump is suspicious.  Will you have a lumpectomy  or a core needle biopsy (larger sample taken) scheduled?  You wont know for sure until the pathologist looks at the specimen under the microscope.  Dont jump the gun here, take a deep breath and try not to worry until you have the facts in front of you.  I know this is easier said than done but you can drive yourself nuts. Take care of yourself
Posts.Title: What is debris? Why did sugeon say it looked malignent? kezzabellecat squidwitch42

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2009 06:23PM KAR wrote: Im with the above poster itchy is usually a sign that nerve endings are reconnecting.  I was extremely itchy after lumpectomy and also had strange "nervy" feelings.  I cant remember how long it lasted sorry. Good Luck
Posts.Title: Anyone have a lumpectomy, that can help with advice...? brynze Ctann

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2009 05:38PM KAR wrote: Hi Dragonfly, Im a bit confused but it sounds like they wont know exactly what course of treatment until mastectomy.  Plastic surgeons can work around radiation treatment, but I thought that it was more difficult to start reconstruction after radiation, it does something to the blood vessels(??)  I would ask my surgeon for a reconstruction/plastic surgeon referral and ask them exactly what they can do and when.  Have you had a sentinel node biopsy yet?  This would tell them if your ca has made it to the lymph nodes.  I had tissue expanders placed at time of bilateral mx but there are other options also like DIEP or other flap procedures.  I would definitely find out recon options before you have mastectomy and before radiation.    Hopefully some ladies who know more than I do will post soon. Good luck
Posts.Title: Timing of prophylactic mastectomy? Dragonfly1976 Dragonfly1976
